sentences.english: We have been guilty of parochialism, of resistance to change.
sentences.chinese: 我們犯了狹隘的錯誤，抵制變革。

sentences.english: Young men usually have one-track mind about girls.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人通常對女孩子的想法很狹隘。

sentences.english: This is a very limited—and limiting—understanding of what sex really is.
sentences.chinese: 這是對於性究竟爲何物的非常狹隘的理解。

sentences.english: Young men usually have one-track mind about sports.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人通常對運動的想法很狹隘。

sentences.english: Your one-track minded thinking will leave you with very little options.
sentences.chinese: 你狹隘的心胸和思想會侷限你的選擇。

sentences.english: There is no room for parochialism or protectionism in our model of the future.
sentences.chinese: 在未來我們的模式中，沒有狹隘和保護主義。

sentences.english: Still, naturalism is not as restrictive as it sounds.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，自然主義並不像它聽起來那麼狹隘。

sentences.english: These narrow concerns are on top of broader fears about the banking system.
sentences.chinese: 這些狹隘的擔憂位於對銀行體制較廣泛擔憂的前列。

sentences.english: "We should be careful not to stir up narrow-minded, extreme nationalism, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該保持謹慎，不要激起狹隘的極端民族主義。

sentences.english: Leaf cells are about 8 times as long as wide and narrow rhombic in shape.
sentences.chinese: 葉細胞的8倍左右，只要廣泛和狹隘的菱形的形狀。

sentences.english: The universality of physics means that history is provincial.
sentences.chinese: 物理學的普遍性意味着歷史是狹隘的。

sentences.english: I get quite annoyed at this very narrow line of questioning.
sentences.chinese: 我對這個過於狹隘的問題感到非常惱火。

sentences.english: The narrow two-party system we have right now has not served us very well.
sentences.chinese: 我們現行的狹隘的兩黨制並沒有很好地爲我們服務。

sentences.english: Great books, on the contrary, transcend the provincial limits of their origin.
sentences.chinese: 相反，偉大的作品超越了它們出身的狹隘侷限。

sentences.english: It's important to listen openly to all ideas instead of narrow-mindedly judging everything.
sentences.chinese: 人應該聽取多方面的聲音，不要狹隘的判斷事物。

sentences.english: Young men usually have one-track mind about sex.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人通常對性的想法很狹隘。

definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
